briefdescription.para: Read a little-endian 32-bit value from an unaligned pointer.
Read a little-endian 64-bit value from an unaligned pointer.
Store a little-endian 32-bit value to an unaligned pointer.
Store a little-endian 64-bit value to an unaligned pointer.
Compute the required buffer size (in bytes) to store a patch list.

simplesect.para: Total bytes for header + indices + values.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a patch list view from a serialized buffer.

detaileddescription.para: The buffer must begin with an ie_patch_list_hdr as described in the file comment. This function validates the header and sets the ie_patch_list_t pointers.

memberdef.argsstring: (void *dst, size_t dst_len, uint64_t nbytes, uint64_t nitems, const uint32_t *idx, const uint8_t *val)
memberdef.name: ie_patch_list_serialize

briefdescription.para: Serialize a patch list into a caller-provided buffer.

detaileddescription.para: The caller provides idx and val arrays. Indices must be strictly increasing and each must be < nbytes.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, non-zero on error (including insufficient dst_len).

briefdescription.para: Apply a patch list to an existing tensor buffer in-place.

detaileddescription.para: Typical usage: memcpy(dst, default_bytes, nbytes); ie_patch_list_apply_inplace(dst, nbytes, &pl);

parameterdescription.para: Destination buffer to modify (must have at least nbytes bytes).

simplesect.para: 0 on success, non-zero on error (bounds, invalid indices).

memberdef.argsstring: (uint64_t nbytes, const uint8_t *mask, const uint8_t *exceptions, uint32_t *idx_out, uint8_t *val_out, uint64_t *out_nitems)
memberdef.name: ie_patch_list_from_mask_exceptions

briefdescription.para: Convert a bitmask + exception stream into a patch list (indices + values).

detaileddescription.para:
This is useful for hybrid formats:
Authoring uses mask+exceptions (cheap to compute).
Runtime uses patch list when exception density is low.

Mask semantics:
1 bit per byte (LSB-first within each mask byte).
exceptions stream provides the patched bytes in ascending byte index order.

Output:
idx_out receives indices (uint32_t per item).
val_out receives values (uint8_t per item).
The caller must allocate idx_out/val_out to hold exactly popcount(mask) items.

briefdescription.para: Patch list implementation: serialization, validation, and application.
